element.name: noise
element.glsl: return vec4(vec3(_noise(vec3(_st*scale, offset*time))), 1.0);

element.name: voronoi
osc
shape
gradient
element.glsl: return vec4(_st, sin(time*speed), 1.0);

element.name: src
element.glsl:
//  vec2 uv = gl_FragCoord.xy/vec2(1280., 720.);
   return texture2D(tex, fract(_st));

element.name: solid
element.glsl: return vec4(r, g, b, a);

element.name: rotate
scale
pixelate
element.glsl:
vec2 xy = vec2(pixelX, pixelY);
   return (floor(_st * xy) + 0.5)/xy;

element.name: posterize
shift
repeat
modulateRepeat
repeatX
modulateRepeatX
repeatY
modulateRepeatY
kaleid
modulateKaleid
scroll
scrollX
element.glsl:
_st.x += scrollX + time*speed;
   return fract(_st);

element.name: modulateScrollX
element.glsl:
_st.x += _c0.r*scrollX + time*speed;
   return fract(_st);

element.name: scrollY
element.glsl:
_st.y += scrollY + time*speed;
   return fract(_st);

element.name: modulateScrollY
element.glsl:
_st.y += _c0.r*scrollY + time*speed;
   return fract(_st);

element.name: add
element.glsl: return (_c0+_c1)*amount + _c0*(1.0-amount);

element.name: sub
element.glsl: return (_c0-_c1)*amount + _c0*(1.0-amount);

element.name: layer
element.glsl: return vec4(mix(_c0.rgb, _c1.rgb, _c1.a), clamp(_c0.a + _c1.a, 0.0, 1.0));

element.name: blend
element.glsl: return _c0*(1.0-amount)+_c1*amount;

element.name: mult
element.glsl: return _c0*(1.0-amount)+(_c0*_c1)*amount;

element.name: diff
element.glsl: return vec4(abs(_c0.rgb-_c1.rgb), max(_c0.a, _c1.a));

element.name: modulate
element.glsl:
//  return fract(st+(_c0.xy-0.5)*amount);
   return _st + _c0.xy*amount;

element.name: modulateScale
modulatePixelate
element.glsl:
vec2 xy = vec2(offset + _c0.x*multiple, offset + _c0.y*multiple);
   return (floor(_st * xy) + 0.5)/xy;

element.name: modulateRotate
modulateHue
element.glsl: return _st + (vec2(_c0.g - _c0.r, _c0.b - _c0.g) * amount * 1.0/resolution);

element.name: invert
element.glsl: return vec4((1.0-_c0.rgb)*amount + _c0.rgb*(1.0-amount), _c0.a);

element.name: contrast
element.glsl:
vec4 c = (_c0-vec4(0.5))*vec4(amount) + vec4(0.5);
   return vec4(c.rgb, _c0.a);

element.name: brightness
element.glsl: return vec4(_c0.rgb + vec3(amount), _c0.a);

element.name: mask
element.glsl:
float a = _luminance(_c1.rgb);
  return vec4(_c0.rgb*a, a*_c0.a);

element.name: luma
element.glsl:
float a = smoothstep(threshold-(tolerance+0.0000001), threshold+(tolerance+0.0000001), _luminance(_c0.rgb));
   return vec4(_c0.rgb*a, a);

element.name: thresh
element.glsl: return vec4(vec3(smoothstep(threshold-(tolerance+0.0000001), threshold+(tolerance+0.0000001), _luminance(_c0.rgb))), _c0.a);

nodes.script: const parents = (id) => (graph ?? _graph).edges.filter(e => e.to === id).flatMap(e => parents(e.from)).concat([id]); return parents(node ?? graph.out ?? 'out')

const parent_graph = _lib.no.runtime.get_parent(_graph); const input = _lib.no.runtime.get_edges_in(parent_graph, _graph.node_id).find(i => i.as === 'fn'); return input ? {fn: input.from, graph: parent_graph, args: args ?? {}} : false

const res_graph = fn_graph ?? _graph; return (...inner_args) => {return _lib.no.executeGraphNode({graph: {...res_graph, nodes: [...res_graph.nodes], edges: [...res_graph.edges]}, lib: _lib})(fn)(Object.keys(args).length > 0 ? Object.assign(args, inner_args.length === 1 ? inner_args[0] : inner_args) : inner_args.length === 1 ? inner_args[0] : inner_args);}

nodes.type: (target: any, value: any, path: string) => any
nodes.script: const keys = path.split('.'); const check = (o, v, k) => k.length === 1 ? {...o, [k[0]]: v, _needsresolve: true} : o.hasOwnProperty(k[0]) ? {...o, [k[0]]: check(o[k[0]], v, k.slice(1)), _needsresolve: true} : o; return check(target, value, keys)
const new_val = Object.assign({}, target); delete new_val[path]; return new_val

const parent = _lib.no.runtime.get_node(_graph, _node.id.substring(0, _node.id.lastIndexOf('/'))); if(!_lib.utility.compare(parent.value, value)) { _lib.no.runtime.add_node(_graph, {...parent , value}); } return value

const parent = _lib.no.runtime.get_node(_graph, _lib.no.runtime.get_parent(_graph, _node.id)); _lib.no.runtime.add_listener(event, parent.id, (graph, ev) => (_lib.no.runtime.add_node(_graph, {...parent , value: ev})), true)
const bc = new BroadcastChannel('events'); bc.onmessage = e => { _lib.no.runGraph(onmessage.graph, onmessage.fn, {message: e}, _lib); }; return bc;
return _lib.no.runGraph(runnable.graph, runnable.fn, Object.assign({}, args, {runnable: undefined}, runnable.args), _lib)

nodes.script: return (element, index, array) => _lib.no.runGraph(fn?.graph ?? _graph, fn?.fn ?? fn, Object.assign({}, fn.args, args, {element, index, array}), _lib);

const runnables = Object.entries(inputs).filter(e => e[0] !== 'args').map(e => [e[0], e[1] && e[1]._Proxy ? e[1]._value : e[1]]).filter(r => r[1] && (!r[1]._Proxy || r[1]._value) && r[1].hasOwnProperty('fn') && r[1].hasOwnProperty('graph')); const filtered_args = Object.fromEntries(Object.entries(args).filter(a => !runnables.find(r => r[0] === a[0]))); return runnables.map(r => r[1]).map(r => ({...r, args: {...r.args, ...filtered_args}}))
return new Promise((resolve, reject) => resolve(_lib.no.runGraph(runnable.graph, runnable.fn, runnable.args, _lib)));

out
nodes.script: return Object.fromEntries((Array.isArray(arr[0]) ? arr[0] : arr).map((v, i, a) => [Math.floor((i / a.length)*100) + "%", v]))

nodes.description: Some HTML plaintext. Usually used as a child of html_element.
An HTML Element. `children` is an array of html_element or html_text, `props` are the attributes for the html element as an object.

nodes.script: return children === undefined ? [] : children.length !== undefined ? children.map(c => _lib.no.resolve(c)).filter(c => !!c).map(c => c.el ?? c) : [children.el ?? children]

if(!(typeof dom_type === 'string' && Array.isArray(children))){ throw new Error('invalid element');} children.filter(c => c).forEach(c => {if(typeof c.dom_type !== 'string'){throw new Error ('invalid child element');}}); return {el: {dom_type, props, children, memo}}
